criteria: Identification of Natural Resources Used by Local Producers
Description of Human Resources Utilized in Local Production
Explanation of Capital Resources Employed by Local Producers
Understanding of the Production of Goods and Services (Past and Present)
descriptions: The student does not identify any natural resources used by local producers.
The student identifies one natural resource used by local producers with limited accuracy.
The student identifies two natural resources used by local producers with reasonable accuracy.
The student identifies three natural resources used by local producers accurately.
The student identifies four or more natural resources used by local producers accurately, demonstrating a solid understanding of their utilization.

The student comprehensively identifies and explains the diverse range of natural resources used by local producers, including historical and contemporary examples, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding.
The student does not describe any human resources utilized by local producers.
The student provides a vague or inaccurate description of one human resource utilized in local production.
The student describes two human resources utilized in local production with some accuracy.
The student accurately describes three human resources utilized in local production.
The student accurately describes four or more human resources utilized in local production, demonstrating a good understanding of their roles.

The student provides a comprehensive and insightful description of the various human resources involved in local production, including skilled labor, management, and entrepreneurial roles, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding.
The student does not explain any capital resources employed by local producers.
The student provides a vague or inaccurate explanation of one capital resource employed in local production.
The student explains two capital resources employed in local production with some accuracy.
The student accurately explains three capital resources employed in local production.
The student accurately explains four or more capital resources employed in local production, demonstrating a good understanding of their significance.

The student offers a comprehensive and nuanced explanation of the diverse capital resources utilized by local producers, including machinery, technology, infrastructure, and financial capital, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding.
The student demonstrates no understanding of how local producers use resources to produce goods and services.
The student shows a limited or inaccurate understanding of how local producers use resources to produce goods and services in either the past or the present.
The student shows a basic understanding of how local producers use resources to produce goods and services, but lacks detail or comparison between past and present methods.
The student demonstrates a clear understanding of how local producers use resources to produce goods and services in both the past and present.
The student demonstrates a strong understanding of the evolution of production methods, comparing and contrasting resource utilization in the past and present with specific examples.

The student provides a comprehensive analysis of the historical and contemporary production methods of local producers, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of the interplay between resources, technology, and economic factors.
